sentence.Network_en: His shirttail protruded from beneath his coat.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的衬衫下摆从外套下面露出来.

entry.def: Shirt-tails are the long parts of a shirt below the waist.

example.ex: He wore sandals and old jeans and his shirt-tails weren't tucked in.
example.tran: 他穿着凉鞋、旧仔裤，衬衫下摆也没塞进裤子里。

means.word_mean: 1. a brief addendum at the end of a newspaper article
2. fabric forming the tail of a shirt

auth_sentence.content: Planned grosgrain ribbon inside the hem made the "tennis tail" a longer back shirttail for easy tucking curl up.

auth_sentence.content: Your shirttail almost certainly carries dust, and that has the potential of scratching your lens.
